meanings.definition: Not in a case or covering.
meanings.sent1: The phone was left uncased on the table.
meanings.sent2: She preferred to keep her laptop uncased for easy access.
meanings.sent3: The uncased pillow looked lonely without its cover.
meanings.sent4: The uncased book revealed its worn-out pages.
meanings.sent5: The uncased jewelry box held only memories of the past.

meanings.definition: To remove from a case or covering.
meanings.sent1: He uncased the camera to take a picture.
meanings.sent2: Please uncased the gift carefully to avoid damaging it.
meanings.sent3: She uncased the umbrella and shook off the raindrops.
meanings.sent4: The detective uncased the evidence to reveal the truth.
meanings.sent5: The magician uncased the rabbit, surprising the audience.
